content.description: The split rock on right is off. Start in the middle of face on lower left jugs, make move up to good incut edge in face, make big move to sloper up and right, match and finish on jugs. using split rock on right side makes this problem v3.
content.location: first large boulder west off trail. If you look out from the top of the Trailside Wall to the west and the leaves aren't too thick you should see it a few hundred feet away. It is part of a rocky clump.

content.description: On the Fat and Happy boulder, start as for Fat and Happy but using all available holds head straight up and slightly left. Kind of grunty and not particularly aesthetic, though the holds are nice.
content.location: On the Fat and Happy Boulder

content.description: Easy right leaning hand and layback crack just to the right of the big prow of the Fat and Happy boulder. A good beginner route or start of the warm-up circuit with a few handjams to start and then laybacks
content.location: On the wall just right of the Fat and Happy boulder's overhanging prow

content.description: Easy handcrack about 8 feet to the right of the overhanging prow of the Fat and Happy boulder. Another good beginner handcrack or easy warm-up.
content.location: on the wall just to the right of the Fat and Happy boulder

content.description: Glenna the good witch. About 10 feet to the right of the start of the main crack of the Blair boulder, climb up the nice face using good sidepulls and edges
content.location: on the Blair Boulder (more like a clump), which is a couple hundred feet directly out from the Trailside Wall. Glenna is ~ 10 right of the main crack

content.description: The boulder sort of sits on a ledge. Sit start about as far right as you comfortably can without feeling like you will fall off the ledge, hands on a nice fat sloper with a crease in the back, feet on a triangular structure at the base. Traverse left using a couple right heel hooks until you get to the lip. Keep hand traversing around the boulder until you get to the back and can throw a foot into the notch and top out
content.location: Left side of the ledge, past the prow

content.description: This is the main right leaning crack on the Blair boulder. Sit start and follow the crack out of the little alcove and to the right, laying back and using a couple good handjams with good feet out on the face, squeezing by a tree and finishing as for Glenna. This route is easy but mildly cool. Would be much improved with a scrub
content.location: The Blair boulder, which is a couple hundred feet directly out from the Trailside Wall

content.description: A new area has been found and recently (2015) has seen some development. It is about 5 minutes hike west of the main trail and consists of a small ledge about 20' tall at its highest and a long boulder with a good traverse and a potentially harder project up an overhanging prow. The ledge has a bunch of easier cracks and potential for probably a few harder lines.This quiet, out of the way spot faces west, so gets afternoon sun, seems to dry quickly and has good quality rock with generally flat landings.For now this can include the various scattered problems between the Trailside Wall and Fat and Happy.
